name: SSH Brute-force.
description: Many devices have common SSH username and password combinations.

name: Telnet Servers
description: Many devices have common telnet username and password combinations.

name: SSLv2/SSLv3
description: SSL version 2 and version 3 should be disabled in most production environments.

name: User Accounts
description: Local and Domain user accounts identified on the machine.

name: Open Windows Shares
description: Windows shared folders that allow anonymous access.

name: Open NFS Shares
description: NFS shared folders that do not require authentication.

name: Open AFP Shares
description: AFP shared folders that do not require authentication.

name: Apache Tomcat Credentials
description: Weak or Default Apache Tomcat Credentials

name: SNMP Default Community Strings
description: SNMP Servers that allow read and/or write access with default community strings.

name: Unauthenticated VNC Access
description: VNC servers that do not require authentication.

name: IPMI Authentication Bypass
description: IPMI authentication bypass using cipher suite zero.

name: Web Server Detection
description: Many web servers have easily exploited vulnerabilities.

name: Default Credentials
description: These services allow access using default credentials.

name: Directory Traversal
description: These web servers are vulnerable to directory traversal flaws.

name: Metasploit
description: These devices have vulnerabilities with associated Metasploit modules.
